alert.note: Alert for Grady; Thomas (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 11 at 4:32PM EDT until July 11 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Western Thomas County in south central Georgia... Grady County in southwestern Georgia... * Until 745 PM EDT. * At 432 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cairo, Thomasville, Ochlocknee, Pine Park, Grady Co A/p, Dawesville, Pasco, Akridge, Beachton, Capel, Moncrief, Princes Still, Spence, Elpino, Metcalf, Rocky Hill, Dillon and Merrillville. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
